# Draft:Warba Bank

----
Warba Bank () is a Kuwaiti Islamic bank established in 2010. It is licensed by the Central Bank of Kuwait and listed on the Boursa Kuwait. Warba Bank offers Islamic financial services including retail banking, corporate finance, and investment banking.
Background
Warba Bank was created by an Amiri Decree in 2009 and began operations in 2010. It is one of several banks in Kuwait providing Sharia-compliant banking products.
Independent coverage
In January 2025, the bank launched the Warba Islamic Income Fund, a $200 million Sharia-compliant investment vehicle structured through the Cayman Islands. The fund, developed in cooperation with Maples Group, targets mid-sized U.S. companies through senior secured financing.
In May 2025, Warba Bank and Gulf Bank disclosed to the Kuwait Stock Exchange that they had signed a memorandum of understanding to explore a potential merger. The banks temporarily suspended trading to announce the news. The merger was described by *Arab News* as part of a broader move to strengthen Kuwait’s Islamic banking sector.
*Arabian Gulf Business Insight* reported that Gulf Bank’s board approved a feasibility study. According to publicly disclosed financial results cited in the report, Warba Bank’s total assets were KD 5.3 billion with a net profit of KD 22.4 million in 2024.
In July 2025, Zawya reported that the Central Bank of Kuwait had approved the appointment of international advisers including Bain & Company, J.P. Morgan, Al Shall Consultancy, Clifford Chance, and Al Tamimi & Company to evaluate the proposed merger.
In early 2025, Warba Bank completed a capital increase through a rights issue that raised KD 436 million. Subscriptions reportedly covered 430% of the offering, according to *Sahefat Alasar*.
